medical_history.chief_complaint: Right lower quadrant pain with associated nausea and vomiting
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at 3 AM this morning with severe, constant, sharp/throbbing RLQ pain radiating to the right flank. The pain was reported at rest and was associated with chills, diaphoresis, nausea, and 1 episode of non-bloody emesis. The patient had a low-grade fever of 100.9Â°F and has not had a bowel movement or passed flatus since the night prior. Pain persists, but there has been no further nausea or vomiting since this morning.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, uterine fibroids, stage IIA triple negative invasive ductal carcinoma of the right breast, left breast fibroadenoma, thyroid nodule, nephrolithiasis, past surgeries include right axillary sentinel node biopsy, bilateral partial mastectomies, right ovarian cystectomy, partial thyroidectomy, evacuation of vaginal hematoma, and right sided electrohydraulic lithotripsy.
medical_history.family_history: Adopted with no knowledge of family history.
